intro: Mida undulata, commonly known as the wavy mida, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are undulating and have a distinctive wavy edge, giving it its common name. Mida undulata produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
